properties.name: Interpretive Trail Shelter and Viewpoint
properties.notes:
Interpretive Trail Shelter and Viewpoint https://www.nps.gov/places/interpretive-trail-shelter-and-viewpoint.htm This shelter is located at the end of the self-guided interpretive trail. Visitors can enjoy seating, a bronze relief map showing historical information about the original settlement, and a view of Saint Croix Island. Stairs lead down from the shelter to a rocky beach.

A vault toilet is available at the start of the trail leading to the shelter. Trash receptables are located at the trailhead and next to the stairs leading to the beach.

properties.name: Ranger Station: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site
properties.notes:
Ranger Station: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site https://www.nps.gov/places/sacr-ranger-station.htm The Ranger Station at Saint Croix Island IHS is open in the summer season. Check Operating Hours & Seasons and Current Conditions for up to date information. 

The Ranger Stations boasts friendly park rangers to answer all of your questions as well as informational exhibits, a park store, passport stamps, an accessible restroom, and drinking water.
